ch.unibas.informatik.hs15.cs203.datarepository.processing

Class MetaDataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.unibas.informatik.hs15.cs203.datarepository.processing.MetaDataManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    class MetaDataManager
extends Object
implements Closeable
    The MetaDataManager class manages meta data. This includes reading of meta data file, manipulating meta data during runtime and finally writing meta data to file. The design of this class and the processing package does not allow two or more processes manipulating the same repository at the same time. Thus this class will fail initialize when the meta data file of the specified repository is locked.
    Author:
    Loris

    • Method Detail

      • getMetaDataManager

        public static MetaDataManager getMetaDataManager(String repoPath)
                                          throws IOException
        Creates a new MetaDataManager for the given repository path. If the given path is not yet recognized as repository (has a meta data file in it), it will be initialized as one. Note: The MetaDataManager must be closed before terminating the application. In case the given repo path is already a repository and said repository is being manipulated by another process of this tool, this method will throw a RuntimeException. Other reasons for failing (throwing a IOException) are: Failed reading the metadata file, Security issues with the JVM which handles this MetaDataManager Or anything else that could lead to an IOException during reading of files.
        Parameters:
        repoPath - The path to the repository. Must be not null.
        Returns:
        The MetaDataManager for the given repository.
        Throws:
        IOException - If one of the above mentioned cases occurs.

      • addMetaData

        public void addMetaData(MetaData data)
        Adds the given MetaData object to the internal buffer. NOTE: The method's visibility may get changed to private in a future update!
        Parameters:
        data - The MetaData object to add to the internal buffer.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Closes this MetaDataManager and releases its resources. Invoke this method before terminating the application Or otherwise the repository gets corrupted and will not be accessible for a long time. In particular the lock of the meta data file gets released as well as the temporary written meta data gets moved to stay permanently.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        IOException

      • generateRandomUUID

        public final String generateRandomUUID()
        Returns a randomly generated UUID. Use this method to get the the ID for a data set.
        Returns:
        A randomly generated UUID.

      • getMetaDataForID

        public MetaData getMetaDataForID(String id)
        Returns the MetaData object to the corresponding id. If the ID does not exist, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        The MetaData object corresponding to the given id or null, if the ID does not exist.

      • replaceMetaData

        public void replaceMetaData(String id,
                            MetaData meta)
        Updates the metadata for the given id. This replaces the currently stored meta data.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the data set which meta data alter.
        meta - The new meta data set.

      • writeMetadata

        public void writeMetadata(MetaData data)
                   throws IOException
        Writes the given MetaData to the meta data file. This method suits for most use cases, methods like addMetaData(MetaData) or writeTemporaryMetaDataFile() are currently visible, but may get hidden in future updates. Firstly the meta data (referred as data) to the internal buffer which gets 'flushed' (e.g. written) to the file system using the Json.toJson() method. The meta data gets firstly written to a temporary meta data file that gets eventually moved to the reliable meta data file.
        Parameters:
        data - The MetaData object to write.
        Throws:
        IOException - If somewhere while writing an i/o error occurs

      • writeTemporaryMetaDataFile

        public void writeTemporaryMetaDataFile()
                                throws IOException
        Writes the currently buffered meta data to a temporary meta data file. NOTE: The method's visibility may get changed to private in a future update!
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while writing the file.
